lines.text: DUMMY
declare int variable n
read input to n
p is an array of string / string pairs witn n + 2 elements
declare string arrays s , s1 , s2 and s3 with size n + 2
create integers x , y , z and z1 = 0
for i from 0 to n exclusive
lines.code: for ( int i = 0 ; i < n ; i ++ )

lines.text: read p [ i ] . first and p [ i ] . second
lines.code: cin >> p [ i ] . first >> p [ i ] . second ;

lines.text: if p [ i ] . second is " rat "
set s [ x ] to p [ i ] . first
increment x
DUMMY
if p [ i ] . second = " woman " or p [ i ] . second = " child "
lines.code: if ( p [ i ] . second == " woman " || p [ i ] . second == " child " )

lines.text: assign p [ i ] . first to s1 [ y ]
increment y by one
DUMMY
if p [ i ] . second = " man "
assign p [ i ] . first to s2 [ z ]
increment z
DUMMY
if p [ i ] . second is " captain "
assign p [ i ] . first to s3 [ z1 ]
increment z1 by one
DUMMY
DUMMY
for j = 0 to x exclusive print s [ j ]
lines.code: for ( int j = 0 ; j < x ; j ++ ) { cout << s [ j ] << endl ; }

lines.text: for j from 0 to y exclusive print s1 [ j ]
lines.code: for ( int j = 0 ; j < y ; j ++ ) { cout << s1 [ j ] << endl ; }

lines.text: for j = 0 to z exclusive print s2 [ j ]
lines.code: for ( int j = 0 ; j < z ; j ++ ) { cout << s2 [ j ] << endl ; }

lines.text: for j = 0 to z1 exclusive print s3 [ j ]
lines.code: for ( int j = 0 ; j < z1 ; j ++ ) { cout << s3 [ j ] << endl ; }

lines.text: DUMMY
